meta.source: seed (based on Hilton phrasebook 'Most important phrases')
meta.notes: This is a small seed. Add more languages/phrases to expand. The app expects an array named 'languages'.

languages.name: Spanish

country_phrases.Table for two, please: Una mesa para dos, por favor

languages.peculiarities: Use 'por favor' for please; 'gracias' is standard. In many Spanish-speaking countries 'cheers' is '¡salud!'.

languages.name: French

country_phrases.Table for two, please: Une table pour deux, s'il vous plaît

languages.peculiarities: Formal and informal pronouns matter (tu/vous). 'santé' for cheers; some use 'à la vôtre'.

languages.name: German
languages.peculiarities: 'Bitte' can be please or you're welcome depending on context. 'Prost' is common for cheers.

languages.name: Italian

country_phrases.Table for two, please: Un tavolo per due, per favore

languages.peculiarities: 'Prego' is used for you're welcome; 'salute' or 'cin cin' for cheers.

languages.name: Portuguese

country_phrases.Where is the bathroom?: Onde é a casa de banho?
country_phrases.Table for two, please: Uma mesa para dois, por favor

languages.peculiarities: In Portuguese 'obrigado' if male speaker, 'obrigada' if female; 'saúde' for cheers.
